definition: the view of a frog in a well (idiom); fig. a narrow view
Jing, one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/surname Jing
a well/CL:口[kou3]/neat/orderly
old variant of 蛙[wa1]
frog/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: These conservative opinions are shallow and limited, and not worthwhile to promote.
sentences.chinese: 这种保守的观点是井蛙之见，不值得提倡。

definition: partial view/limited outlook
lit. to view the sky from the bottom of a well (idiom); ignorant and narrow-minded
shallow and crude/meager (knowledge or skill)
the frog at the bottom of the well (idiom)/fig. a person of limited outlook and experience
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
in my humble opinion (idiom)

blind people touch an elephant (idiom, from Nirvana sutra 大般涅槃經|大般涅盘经[da4 ban1 Nie4 pan2 jing1]); fig. unable to see the big picture/to mistake the part for the whole/unable to see the wood for the trees
ridiculous self-importance (idiom); arrogance
to be ridiculous/to make a fool of oneself
learned person/expert in a certain field/abbr. to 方家[fang1 jia1]
lit. Yelang thinks highly of itself (idiom)/fig. foolish conceit
lit. the eye cannot see the eyelashes (idiom); fig. unable to see one's own faults/to lack self-awareness/truths too close to home

lit. Ying writes a letter and Yan reads it/fig. to misinterpret the original meaning/to pile up errors/refers to the letter from capital 郢[Ying3] of 楚[Chu3] in which the inadvertent words "hold up the candle" are mistaken by the minister of 燕[Yan1] as "promote the wise"
to make a fool of oneself/to make oneself a laughing stock
prejudiced/narrow-minded
